definition: to suspend/to hang up/to hang a person
a string of 100 cash (arch.)/to lament/to condole with/variant of 吊[diao4]
surname Lan/abbr. for Lanzhou 蘭州|兰州[Lan2 zhou1], Gansu
orchid (蘭花|兰花 Cymbidium goeringii)/fragrant thoroughwort (蘭草|兰草 Eupatorium fortunei)/lily magnolia (木蘭|木兰)

sentences.english: And some plants do a much better job than the spider plant.
sentences.chinese: 一些植物的效果要比吊兰好的多。

sentences.english: Spider plants are among those that were found to be most effective in removing formaldehyde.
sentences.chinese: 吊兰是业已发现最能有效去除甲醛的植物之一。

sentences.english: Every time after school, I looked at the basin of Chlorophytum worried.
sentences.chinese: 每次放学，我都担心地望着那盆吊兰。

sentences.english: Last winter Grandmother left her spider plant outdoors and forgot about it.…
sentences.chinese: 去年冬天，祖母忘了把屋外的吊兰拿进来。

sentences.english: Relatively good results have asparagus fern plants, Chlorophytum, money, orange.
sentences.chinese: 较好的结果，芦笋蕨类植物，吊兰，金钱，橙色。

sentences.english: Karyotype study on Chlorophytum malayense and Diuranthera major.
sentences.chinese: 大叶吊兰和鹭鸶兰的核型研究。

sentences.english: As time goes by, Chlorophytum also accompany me with a long high, with thrive.
sentences.chinese: 随着时间的流逝，吊兰也伴我一同长高，一同茁壮。
